Flash.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: a type of cleaning substance for floors and other hard surfaces, sold in the UK as a liquid or powder
Flash.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to shine suddenly and brightly for a short time, or to make something shine in this way
Flash.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: Red warning lights flashed on and off (=shone for a short time and then stopped shining).
Why is that guy flashing his headlights at me?
Flash.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: to be shown quickly on television, on a computer, or on a film
Flash.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: Images of the war flashed across the screen.
Flash.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: to show something to someone for only a short time
Flash.translation[1].definitions[3].defi: to send news or information somewhere quickly by radio, computer, or satellite
Flash.translation[1].definitions[3].exam: Reporters at the scene flashed the news to their offices.
Flash.translation[1].definitions[4].exam: A meteor flashed through the sky.
Flash.translation[1].definitions[5].defi: if your eyes flash, they look very bright for a moment, especially because of a sudden emotion
Flash.translation[1].definitions[5].exam: Janet’s blue eyes flashed with anger.
Flash.translation[1].definitions[6].defi: if a man flashes, or if he flashes someone, he shows his sexual organs in public
Flash.translation[1].definitions[7].defi: if a period of time or an event flashes by or flashes past, it seems to end very quickly
Flash.translation[1].definitions[7].exam: Our vacation seemed to just flash by.
Flash.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: a bright light that shines for a short time and then stops shining
Flash.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: A flash of lightning lit up the night sky.
Flash.translation[2].definitions[1].defi: a special bright light used when taking photographs indoors or when there is not much light
Flash.translation[2].definitions[2].defi: if there is a flash of something brightly coloured or shiny, it appears suddenly for a short time
Flash.translation[2].definitions[2].exam: The bird vanished in a flash of blue.
Flash.translation[2].definitions[3].defi: a system of instructions for a computer that is used especially to make pictures on a website appear to move
Flash.translation[2].definitions[5].defi: a small piece of coloured cloth worn on the shoulder of a military uniform
Flash.translation[3].definitions[0].defi: looking very new, bright, and expensive – used to show disapproval
Flash.translation[3].definitions[1].defi: liking to have expensive clothes and possessions so that other people notice you – used to show disapproval
Flash.translation[3].definitions[1].exam: Chris didn’t want to seem flash in front of his mates.
Flash.translation[4].definitions[0].defi: a computer program that is used to design moving images, especially on websites
